scan.title: Find Asset
scan.subtitle: Scan a QR code or enter an asset code manually
scan.pointCamera: Point your camera at a QR code to scan

cameraError.title: Failed to start camera
cameraError.subtitle: Please ensure camera permissions are granted and try again
cameraError.permissionDeniedDesc: Click the camera icon in your browser's address bar and select 'Allow'. Then refresh the page and try again.
cameraError.notHttpsDesc: Camera access requires HTTPS. Use localhost for development or deploy to a secure server. Check if your URL starts with 'https://' or 'http://localhost'.
cameraError.noCameraDesc: Ensure your device has a working camera. Check if other apps can access it. For external cameras, verify the USB connection.
cameraError.cameraInUseDesc: Close other applications using the camera (Zoom, Teams, Skype, etc.). Check for other browser tabs accessing the camera.
cameraError.quickFix1: Refresh the page and click 'Allow' when prompted
cameraError.quickFix2: Check browser settings: Settings â†’ Privacy â†’ Camera
cameraError.quickFix3: Try a different browser (Chrome, Firefox, Edge)
cameraError.quickFix4: Use the 'Manual Entry' tab as an alternative
cameraError.alternative: ðŸ’¡ Can't fix the camera? Use the 'Manual Entry' tab to type the asset code directly!

manualEntry.hint: Type the asset code and press Enter or click Search

assetForm.validationError: Please fill in all required fields
assetForm.templateSectionDesc: Select a template to auto-fill common asset details
assetForm.assignmentSectionDesc: Search for the primary user of the asset
assetForm.technicalSectionDesc: Search Intune device to auto-fill brand, model, and serial number
assetForm.searchIntuneHint: Search by device name or serial number to auto-fill details
assetForm.aliasHint: Optional - a more readable name for this asset
assetForm.assetNameDeviceHint: Official device name - required if no serial number
assetForm.deviceNotLinked: Device not linked to any user in Intune
assetForm.lookupDeviceBySerial: Look up device by serial number
assetForm.deviceNotFoundBySerial: No device found with this serial number in Intune
assetForm.assetNameAutoFetched: DeviceName from Intune - auto-fetched by serial number

bulkCreate.title: Bulk Create Assets
bulkCreate.modeDescription: Choose how you want to add multiple assets
bulkCreate.templateModeDesc: Create identical assets with a template
bulkCreate.csvModeDesc: Import assets from a CSV file
bulkCreate.settingsDescription: Configure how many assets you want to create
bulkCreate.advancedDescription: Add technical details and lifecycle information
bulkCreate.serialNumberPrefixHint: Required - e.g., SN for SN-0001, SN-0002, etc.
bulkCreate.orClickToSelect: or click to select a file
bulkCreate.csvHelp: Only valid assets will be imported. Hover over error icons to see details.
bulkCreate.csvNoData: CSV file is empty or contains no data rows

export.title: Export Inventory
export.subtitle: Export your asset data to Excel or CSV format
export.noColumns: Please select at least one column to export

templates.title: Templates
templates.subtitle: Manage reusable asset templates for quick creation
templates.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete template '{{name}}'?
templates.templateNameHint: Unique name to identify this template
templates.ownerHint: Optional - can be overwritten when creating
templates.noTemplatesDesc: Create your first template to get started

errors.networkError: Network Error. Please check if the backend API is running.
errors.apiNotRunningDesc: The backend server appears to be offline. Please start the API to continue.
errors.step1: Open a terminal in the project directory
errors.step4: Wait for the API to start at http://localhost:5052
errors.alternative: Alternative: Use mock data mode for development
errors.contactSupport: If this error persists, please contact support or check the browser console for more details.
